input:
This is a Basement Remodel project due to a basement flood. Basement flood caused water damage to the main area of the basement and the 1/2 bathroom. The basement is 1600 sq ft, and the 1/2 bathroom is 300 sq ft. The basement requires a 4ft flood cut, removal and replacement of the laminate floor, relocation of all contents in the basement to storage during the repair process. Additionally, replace the sheetrock and insulation at the 4ft flood cut, apply texture, and re-paint. Ensure drying and cleaning of the area before repair. In the 1/2 bathroom, replace the 300 sq ft tile floor, and re-paint.

Quantities: For drywall, insulation, drywall texture, and work at flood cut, calculate the wall square footage as perimeter X flood cut height.

Paint: Include all walls and ceilings.

Cleaning: Set unit price to $4.00/sq ft.

For contents, include these line items: Labor and packing costs for 2 guys at $80/hour per guy for one day. Additionally, include reasonable costs for materials and supplies. Cost of transporting items to storage. Rental cost of a mid-size storage unit of 10*20 unit.

rows.label: Install Drywall at Walls: Hang, Tape, and Finish
